title: I Love My Lord
author: Madame Jeanne-Marie Bouvier de la Motte-Guyon (1648-1717) bio

v1: I love my Lord, but with no love of mine,
For I have none to give;
I love Thee, Lord, but all the love is Thine,
For by Thy love I live.
I am as nothing, and rejoice to be
Emptied, and lost, and swallowed up in Thee.
v2: Thou, Lord, alone, art all Thy children need,
From Thee the streams of blessedness proceed,
Fountain of life, and all-abounding grace,
Our source, our center, and our dwelling place.
